pros: Love the department I’m in, we’re like family. If someone needs help meeting a deadline, someone is always there to lend a hand.
cons: Other departments that don’t pay attention to deadlines.

pros: Enjoy the teamwork and vision of the school.
cons: None, very happy with my employer.

pros: Great administration and positive environment
cons: Sometimes teaching night and Saturday classes is needed

pros: Good for Entry Level techs
cons: No advancement and will take 20 years to work to top of payscale

job_title: Program Director/ Instructor in Elkhorn, WI
pros: most of colleagues, students, opportunities for great experiences outside of the classroom
cons: administration more concerned with quantity over quality

job_title: Community College Instructor in Kenosha, WI
pros: The faculty, support staff, and students are wonderful.
cons: HR and executive leadership do not support faculty.

review_title: Good place to work, misguided focus
pros:
1) I love my coworkers and enjoy coming to work (even if virtual now)
2) We get a lot of vacation time and the college cares about employee work-life balance.
3) When everyone was in person, there were a lot of fun things for employees to do.
cons:
1) The college admits to discrimination. The WTCS Commitment to Progress states "WTCS will support facilitated, sustained space for conversation and policy work on the impact and dismantling of systemic racism starting internally at each college and the System Office."
2) COVID has left everyone basically at home and small class size which affects the budget. Most of my co-workers don't seem to work as much as before we got sent home.

job_title: Law Enforcement Training Technician in Ocala, FL
pros:
Pay is ok
That's about it
cons:
Incompetent deans
Incompetent provost
Incompetent instructors
Class war between admin, faculty and staff.
Too many administrators justifying their existence by instituting ridiculous policies that are counter productive.
Willing to spend stupid amounts of money on how the school looks, but not salary or tenured faculty.

pros: Individual teams are very hands on and welcoming
cons: There can be miscommunication from the top-down. Not a realistic chance for growth

pros: Great pay for hours worked
cons: Administration could be a bit more timely in communication

review_title: Great place to be an adjunct
pros: I can teach while still working a regular full time job
cons: Not a lot of opportunity to move in to full time faculty

pros: I am surrounded by so many encouraging people who want to help you grow and succeed. The work environment is fast-paced and I love the student interaction. I have been fortunate enough to find the right place for my career goals.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about my experiences at Gateway. It is truly a dream job for me.

review_title: No Opportunities and NO support here.
pros: Flexible schedule.  Nice computer labs.
cons:
Students are disrespectful to instructors. Students expect you to do their work for them and will become rude if they are graded fairly. 
 There is far too much work expected of adjuncts  for the small pay compensated. If you have ten or more years to wait for a full time opening, it may be alright, but most people do not have time to invest a decade or more of their lives in the hopes of maybe being hired full time.

pros: Get experience and pay  while  attending school.I was able to use the my course knowledge to improve how they do business all the areas in which I did internship, work-study hours. This it's a business casual dress, time off is granted with proper notice.
cons: I have no cons with Gateway.

pros: I love teaching my skills to new students, displaced workers or individuals who want to learn new skills to get ahead. I love it when my students "get it"!  My Dean and Associates are wonderful to work with.
cons: Wish I could get more teaching opportunities.

pros: Great staff, fantastic equipment, motivated students
cons: Training was a little lacking, but after the first semester I was up to speed.  Technology is acceptable but could be improved

pros: Opportunity for professional growth. Students are motivated to learn.
cons: I wish I was full time instructor.

pros: Flexible and good to work with in development of courses for adjunct instructors.
cons: Last at this location in 2002 - no current information

pros: I love working for Gateway Technical College, everyone is very friendly
cons: I didn't get enough hours as a casual

pros: Gateway allows employees to grow. Managers really listen to employees input.
cons: Many different initiatives that sometimes overwhelm new employees.

pros: Wonderful students, staff and teachers
cons:
Poor leadership.   Constant complaining about staff, especially teachers
Employees who have left for other jobs or career changes are bad mouthed.   Watch your back, the knife is coming.

pros: Awesome Boss, really good pay, work around student's schedules.
cons: Only part time hours no benefits

pros: Worked with some good people.
cons: Low pay if you are not full-time.
